title: 110_hr3930
content: The Act may be cited as the "Lesser Prairie Chicken National Habitat Preservation Area Act of 2008". It includes definitions for various terms used in the Act. SEC. 2. DEFINITIONS. The Act defines key terms such as State land, map, Federal land, Secretary, State, County, and Preservation Area. The Secretary may convey all US rights in Federal land to the State in exchange for State land rights. The exchange includes surface, subsurface, mineral, and water rights, following federal land policies. No management plan amendment is needed for the exchange. The Secretary may require additional terms and conditions for the land exchange to protect US interests, without needing an amendment to the Mimbres Resource Management Plan. SEC. 4. LESSER PRAIRIE CHICKEN NATIONAL HABITAT PRESERVATION AREA. Established in the County, the Lesser Prairie Chicken National Habitat Preservation Area aims to protect, conserve, and enhance habitat for the Lesser Prairie Chicken. The Preservation Area consists of approximately 28,168 acres of public land and 9,402 acres of acquired land. The Secretary is required to submit a map and legal description of the Preservation Area to Congress within 30 days of the enactment of this Act. The map and legal description for the Lesser Prairie Chicken National Habitat Preservation Area will be available for public inspection at various offices including the Bureau of Land Management and the County Clerk in Roswell, New Mexico. SEC. 5. MANAGEMENT OF THE PRESERVATION AREA. The Secretary manages the Preservation Area to protect the habitat for the Lesser Prairie Chicken, following specific laws. Only uses that further the area's purposes are allowed, with restrictions on motorized vehicles. Preservation Area designated for vehicular use under the management plan, subject to restrictions. Land managed by the Bureau of Land Management within the area is withdrawn from various activities under public land laws. Hunting and trapping allowed in the area. Hunting and trapping are allowed in the Preservation Area, with limitations set by the Secretary for public safety and compliance with laws. The Secretary must consult with the State agency before closing any portion of the area to hunting and trapping. Grazing may also be permitted by the Secretary. The Secretary may allow grazing for vegetative management to enhance Lesser Prairie Chicken habitat. Activities outside the Preservation Area are permitted on private land within the area. Land in the Preservation Area can only be acquired from willing sellers through purchase, exchange, or donation and must be managed according to the Act. The Secretary may establish interpretative sites. The Secretary may establish interpretative sites in the Preservation Area to interpret historical, cultural, scientific, archaeological, natural, and education resources. SEC. 6. MANAGEMENT PLAN. The Secretary must develop a comprehensive plan for the long-term protection and management of the Preservation Area within 1 year of this Act's enactment. The plan should outline appropriate uses and management in accordance with relevant laws, incorporate decisions from other management plans, and consider information from studies and local historical involvement. The bill aims to establish the Lesser Prairie Chicken National Habitat Preservation Area in New Mexico, involving a land exchange between State and Bureau of Land Management land. The plan includes long-term protection and management, considering local historical involvement and relevant laws.
